content.raw:
This is of course a very welcome addition, especially if this is the only Python parser out there.

By the re-nesting routine, do you mean `_collapse_properties`? It’s the only part that I couldn’t get the purpose of, from just looking at the code, and it looks like it’s not used at this point?

Another small question: is there need for the `as_dict` method? Looks like it’s not used and the `_MzTabTable` object is discarded after the parsing is done.

Also, why is key checking done this way in `__getitem__`? Are there supposed to be other designations for the same types of data that may be added?
content.html:
This is of course a very welcome addition, especially if this is the only Python parser out there.

By the re-nesting routine, do you mean _collapse_properties? It’s the only part that I couldn’t get the purpose of, from just looking at the code, and it looks like it’s not used at this point?

Another small question: is there need for the as_dict method? Looks like it’s not used and the _MzTabTable object is discarded after the parsing is done.

Also, why is key checking done this way in __getitem__? Are there supposed to be other designations for the same types of data that may be added?
